2.text: 1) Sandriya's brother showed a magic trick. This is how he did it. Work in pairs and follow the instructions.
2.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>1) <phoneme alphabet='ipa' ph='sand̪rija'>Sandriya</phoneme>'s brother showed a magic trick. This is how he did it. Work in pairs and follow the instructions.</prosody></speak>

3.text: Well friends, here's a new magic trick. Here is a glass of water. Can you see this? This is a paper bag. Pour water into this bag. Watch carefully. Empty the bag of water. Where's the water? It has vanished. Thank you. How did we do that?
3.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Well friends, here's a new magic trick. Here is a glass of water. Can you see this? This is a paper bag. Pour water into this bag. Watch carefully. Empty the bag of water. Where's the water? It has vanished. Thank you. How did we do that?</prosody></speak>

4.text: We put a big sponge inside the paper bag!
4.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>We put a big sponge inside the paper bag!</prosody></speak>

5.text: 2) What are the magic tricks that you know? Write the steps that you will follow to present your magic trick to the class.
5.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>2) What are the magic tricks that you know? Write the steps that you will follow to present your magic trick to the class.</prosody></speak>

7.text: Venura read the following notice and wrote a note to Rajan.
7.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'><phoneme alphabet='ipa' ph='venura'>Venura</phoneme> read the following notice and wrote a note to <phoneme alphabet='ipa' ph='raːd͡ʒan'>Rajan</phoneme>.</prosody></speak>

9.text: The Inventors' Club has organized "Creative Mind Competition" Age: 10 – 19 years Deadline: 19th June For further information contact: Mr. Nath Sivasundaran Teacher-in-charge (Science)
9.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>The Inventors' Club has organized "Creative Mind Competition" Age: 10 – 19 years Deadline: 19th June For further information contact: Mr. Nath <phoneme alphabet='ipa' ph='sivasund̪aran'>Sivasundaran</phoneme> Teacher-in-charge (Science)</prosody></speak>
